etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in The Lancet. From invert + -or

definitions: A device or apparatus which converts direct current into alternating current.
A device or apparatus used to periodically reverse the direction of an electric current; a commutator.
Any muscle involved in inversion of the foot; especially the tibialis posterior or tibialis anterior.
A device which converts either of the two binary digits or signals into the other, so that every ‘1’ is replaced with a ‘0’ and vice versa.
